discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Should be B, _collabedge is use when the client is outside of the network (and when there is an expressway).
In this scenario, the administrator configure manually the FQDN of the serveur (it's work), so the client can join the server from inside, so B is the good answer

choices.D: Add a _collab-edge._tls.company.com SRV record to the branch DNS server.
choices.A: Add a firewall rule to allow TCP/8443 from the branch to HQ.
choices.C: Reinstall the Jabber clients with UPN_DISCOVERY_ENABLED=false.
choices.B: Add a _cisco-uds._tcp.company.com SRV record to the branch DNS server.

questions.question_text: A collaboration engineer is troubleshooting an issue with Cisco Jabber for Windows clients. Users in a new branch location report that “cannot locate server” is displayed when they launch the client. When the engineer manually configures the server settings on a client, the client logs in successfully. The Cisco IM and Presence servers are located across the WAN at the corporate HQ. Which action resolves the issue?

choices.D: “Standard CTI secure connection” and the “Standard CTI Enabled” group.
choices.C: “Standard CTI allows control of phones supporting rollover mode” and the “Standard CTI Enabled” group.
choices.B: “Standard CTI allows control of all devices” and the “Standard CTI Enabled” group.
choices.A: “Standard CTI allows control of phones supporting Xfer and conf” and the “Standard CTI Enabled” group.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A collaboration engineer is troubleshooting a Cisco Jabber for Windows client issue. The end user reports that they cannot control their Cisco 8845 IP Phone from the Cisco Jabber client. Which configuration addition to the end user profile resolves the issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A as per cisco documentation

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/jabber/11_5/CJAB_BK_D00D8CBD_00_deployment-installation-guide-cisco-jabber115/CJAB_BK_D00D8CBD_00_deployment-installation-guide-cisco-jabber115_chapter_0111.html


Remember:
If you are provisioning users with secure phone capabilities, do not assign the users to the Standard CTI Secure Connection group.
Certain phone models require additional control groups, as follows:

 Cisco Unified IP Phone 9900, 8900, or 8800 series or DX series, select Standard CTI Allow Control of Phones supporting Connected Xfer and conf. 

Cisco Unified IP Phone 6900 series, select Standard CTI Allow Control of Phones supporting Rollover Mode.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
because of blocking international calls is A the best practice

Selected Answer: B
not a fan of this question as it assumes a NA Numbering Plan and Call routing.
Nevertheless I think they expect answer B

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An engineer discovers that many international calls were made from Cisco Unity Connection. The engineer examines the default transfer Restriction Patterns. Which action prevents a voicemail user from transferring calls to international destinations?

choices.D: Modify the 9+* pattern by using the 9011* pattern and click Save.
choices.A: For the +” pattern, select Blocked and click Save.
choices.C: Click Add New, enter the 9011* pattern in a new field, and click Save.
choices.B: Click Add New and enter the 9011* pattern in a new field. Select Blocked and click Save.
